meanings.definition: Having the form of a disc.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a disciform painting with perfect circular shapes.
meanings.sent2: The disciform moon shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The disciform cookies were so round and perfect that they looked like mini frisbees.
meanings.sent4: Her disciform hat cast a circular shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The disciform mirror reflected her face in a perfectly round shape.

meanings.sent1: She found a disciform rock on the beach that looked like a perfect circle.
meanings.sent2: The disciform of the UFO made it stand out in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The disciform of the pizza made it easy to share with friends.
meanings.sent4: The disciform of the coin glinted in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The disciform of the clock made it easy to read the time from any angle.
